With the help of a professional psychotherapist, in a safe and supportive environment, I was able to process those dynamics that were disconnected from my embodied awareness. Tapping into that capacity to recover from difficulties still is a key factor in my own process of healing and grounding. This resilience, at any level of development in human beings, is what I tap into when working with my clients. I believe this is the key for emotional healing and personal growth to continue living a more fulfilled and integrated life."

name: Sujin Sabrina Gabel
title: Psychologist
description: "At Seesaw Psychology Group, our work with families is collaborative and strength-based. We provide neuropsychological evaluation, therapy, parent coaching, consultation and social emotional classes and playgroups. We specialize in assessment and treatment for children and adolescents (12 months to 18 years of age)."

name: Mor Gavish
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Do You Want to Feel at Home Inside Yourself?  Would you like to quiet and soothe your anxiety and fear?  Would you like to feel connected and close to your partner? Whether you are experiencing a challenging time in your life now or have survived a traumatic event or just feel that it might be helpful to talk with someone - You don't have to go through it alone.  In my experience working with many clients, I have found that although your struggle feels very alive now, there can be a different way to live your life."

name: Patrice Catanio
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I see individuals for short term singular issue or transitional issues, as well as longer, deeper therapy for multiple issues and what has seemed like intractable patterns.  I've found that people are people, and whether man or woman, straight or LGBT, young or older, there are hurdles that can really benefit from therapy.  My experience has taught me that all issues CAN be resolved, bringing a more fulfilling relationship with yourself and with others.  Despite my license name I actually do not see couples or families.  However, I have great referrals should the need for either come up during our work together."

name: Amy Park
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Many of us appear to be functioning well in life, but in reality feel like imposters, often stressed and unsatisfied in our lives and relationships.  I foster the discovery of genuine peace and fulfillment through "undoing aloneness," helping clients embrace their best and worst selves, and unearthing a more self-compassionate and authentic way of being.  My clients are typically individuals and couples, seeking treatment for anxiety, perfectionism, trauma, and a wide variety of relational issues."

name: Pia Litz
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "I believe in the innate healing power within each individual, and I aim to empower this ability within you.  You can be your own best friend, and my purpose in life is to show you how.  Often during times of transition, trauma and loss we can feel disconnected and lost.  Our insecurities and fears come out, and our attempts to hide them can become time consuming and energy draining.Overcoming this struggle and rediscovering our connections and self-esteem are worthwhile goals."

name: Karen Palamos
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I am interested in listening to you so that I can understand your situation and what you'd like help with.  Through listening and actively engaging, I will assess how to best meet your needs and we will talk about how to proceed.  Now in my 20th year of practice I have helped many people through major transitions in their lives, often times involving loss & grief, relational issues and increasing self esteem.  If you've been feeling stuck in your life, now is the time to reach out for assistance toward cultivating a greater sense of joy."

name: Annette Pinto
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description:
"I have helped many people improve coping skills and interpersonal relationships. I'm focused on your needs and committed to having you better prepared to handle your current issues each time you leave my office.
I am interactive and enjoy having an open dialog to help you find lasting solutions. We will explore any underlying unconscious issues from your past that may be contributing to your current life. Illuminating why you may be drawn to act in a negative way (even though you don't want to) often can help you to make better choices and feel better about life."

name: Lena Mullins
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "In my psychotherapy practice I enjoy empowering individuals, couples, expectant and new mothers to develop self-confidence in their choices as they navigate a new phase or challenge in their lives."

name: Katie McKenna
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "Let's work together to help you live your best life! I'm a passionate and understanding therapist, who will work with you to help you feel better and appreciate the strengths you already have. In addition to providing therapy, I have experience working in the tech industry and am well-equipped to support my client's through the stressors and challenges related to working in fast-paced environments."

name: Gwendolyn Evans
title: Psychologist
description: "Are you anxious or depressed? Struggling with emotional or physical infidelity? Has the passion died in your relationship? Do you want more sex and intimacy? Feeling overwhelmed and undervalued by your partner?  Are you lonely in your marriage?  Are you struggling with racial or cross-cultural issues?  Tired of the same fights with your spouse, your family, your boss, your kids?"

name: Carl Montgomery
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "If you've been in therapy before and had a not-so-great experience, chances are you'll fare better with me. I can't guarantee this, but I say it confidently because I'm very good at adapting how I work to each client's needs and abilities - especially in the early going."

name: Leslie Carson
title: Counselor
description: "Chances are you could be feeling and performing better than you are right now.  Most people are struggling with stress and pain from life events like past traumas and regrets, life transitions, challenging relationships, grief, loneliness, finances and more.  Stress over time takes away from your mental and physical quality of life.  Through counseling, we can work together to move you towards your best you."

name: Dania Sacks March
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "The line between what we want, need, and can deal with can be a juggling act and striking a balance is not always easy. Think of your life as an overflowing suitcase. Consider what it would be like to have help opening that suitcase, and take out or adjust a few things in it to lessen the load. That's services with me. I aim to help you come to appreciate and embody your truest self and let go of, or shift, the things that no longer serve you."

name: Rochelle Greenhagen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Therapy provides an opportunity to slow down amidst the rapid paces of our lives and look around to explore the ways we cope with difficulty. Ultimately, this teaches us more about who we truly are. Pain is inevitable in our lives, but it can function as a window into our truer, deeper selves. Contacting and nurturing the parts of ourselves that have been hurt, shamed, or neglected helps us to more fully embody our unique selves and find freedom from the constraints of our suffering."

name: H. Ameeta Singh
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I work with clients to cultivate deeper insight and understanding about the ways in which our life experiences and ways of being in the world impact our choices and behaviors. In working this way I have found that clients feel empowered to make changes to unhealthy behaviors and create proactive coping strategies for managing situations they may not, as yet, be able to change.  I draw upon clients' strengths, culture, spirituality and community as a means of facilitating healing, empowerment and change. My therapeutic approach is grounded in social justice principles."

name: Emily Adams
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate
description: "Asking for help is a sign of strength. My main goal is to create a safe environment for you to process and work through areas of your life that are impacting your happiness and wellbeing. My work with adults, teens, and couples is collaborative and supportive, tailoring your therapy to your specific needs. Whether you are struggling with your inner critic, feeling weighed down by past experiences, or unsatisfied in life and relationships, there is no wrong reason to seek therapy. My practice is mindfulness-based, and influenced by a number of modalities including bodywork, movement practices, and the arts."

name: Rick Pomfret
title: Psychologist
description: "I'll work with you in a collaborative, interactive and supportive way.  We'll work together to understand the dynamics of where you are now, develop clear goals and a path to get there that works for you. I enjoy working with adults and children of various backgrounds and beliefs."

name: Patrick J. Norton
title: Psychologist
description: "As a seasoned, depth-oriented psychologist, I will work collaboratively with you in exploring the depths of your experience to get to the root of whatever ails you. I find that cultivating a warm, friendly, caring stance allows an individual to move more readily in the direction towards healing and the resolution of problems and difficulties. Consequently, you can be the person you want to be thereby realizing greater self-acceptance and generating more successful relationships. My areas of clinical focus include working with chronic shame, gender identity, life transitions, grief & loss, self-exploration, sexuality, times of crisis."

name: Ken Gladstone
title: Psychologist
description: "In my practice, I enjoy meeting with a range of people in terms of age, demographics, and psychological needs.  In addition to extensive training, I have many years of experience providing care for those in need here in the Bay Area.  I also have specific expertise in the areas of trauma, substance abuse, anxiety, and relationship difficulties.  I incorporate the well-researched areas of psychodynamic, family systems, and cognitive-behavioral therapies into my work. As each person is different, I carefully tailor our work to your needs and your goals."

name: Amy Ruben
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate
description: "I'm a body-oriented, ritual-honoring, experiential kind of therapist. Whether you are struggling with anxiety, depression, the stresses of everyday life or the aftermath of trauma, we will focus on both alleviating your immediate sources of distress and increase your sense of safety, security and well-being. As a holistically and somatically-oriented therapist, I believe it is important to integrate the mind, body and spirit in the process of psychotherapy so that deeper awareness and change is possible. As we meet, I will offer you an opportunity to work experientially, as well as to share through talking."

name: Tara Cronin
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Hello and welcome! I started SF Creative Therapy to help individuals overcome relationship, grief and trauma issues with a creative approach. This allows negative or problem situations to transform into positive solutions. I am a certified grief specialist and also work with pet loss, cancer survival and healing from painful break-ups. I enter each therapy session with sincerity and compassion and will work with you to develop a plan for reaching your goals. If you are experiencing pain from a relationship or situation, I encourage you to call or e-mail to set up a consultation appointment to talk further."

name: Megan Williams
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I offer a warm, collaborative approach intended to foster personal growth and self understanding for individuals and couples. I specialize in helping clients navigate through relationship challenges  addictions, self esteem issues ,Premarital and Divorce challenges. Using psychodynamic , holistic and present moment therapeutic approaches , my work is intended to help clients cultivate their own inner healing and enabling them to make meaningful and lasting change. Honoring every individual and couple as unique, I bring an engaged and compassionate presence to our work together."

name: Maureen Lindmeier-Arrow Psychotherapy
title: Psychologist
description: "At Arrow Psychotherapy we offer straightforward and effective therapy tailored to meet your individual needs. We help identify your strengths and use them to achieve realistic, attainable goals. Whether you are struggling with a major life transition, career dissatisfaction, relationship difficulty, or more generalized unhappiness with the direction you're headed, together we can achieve a richer understanding of your life and the behavioral patterns that may be impeding your personal growth. Our demeanor is honest, warm, and conscientious, which helps us connect to with people from all walks of life."

name: Valarie Eilert
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Tired of not living fully. Get therapy now! Learn tools to be more engaged and present with your life and the people in it. One such tool is mindfulness. Mindfulness is a way of directing your attention away from habitual thoughts(lists, judgements, negative self talk)and toward experiencing the present(where your life is actually being lived).                                                                                                 I believe in the power of this work. Depression, anxiety, low self-esteem, difficult relationships and addictions can be products of molding to others' ideas of who you "should" be. I will work with you to uncover who you want to be."

name: Elizabeth Ehrenberg
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "Welcome. I do this work because I care deeply about healing through connection and compassionate relationships. I love working with people so they can learn about themselves, challenge old stories that may no longer serve, and ultimately live more authentic lives. Each of us is strong, powerful and beautiful, with unique gifts to offer this world. Yet sorrow is real, and having a safe and compassionate space to address grief, transition, relationship issues, trauma, anxiety, depression, addiction, and questions about gender and sexuality is fundamental and healing."

name: Maya Maria Grodman
description: "I work with partners of survivors of sexual violence. I help you understand what survivors might be going through, and learn positive ways to communicate about needs and boundaries in relationships. We'll develop tools so you can be an active participant in their healing, and create solid ground in your relationship. I work with you to figure out what you need, and make sure you are supported in your own process. Our work can help make the healing process not just manageable, but powerful and meaningful for you both. Family and friends of survivors welcome. http://www.mayamariaconsulting.com"

name: The Clinic Without Walls
description: "The Clinic Without Walls (TCWOW) offers FREE SERVICES to Bay Area residents. Our clinic provides a wide range of psychological services including individual, couple, family, and group therapy. We work with children, adults, and families. The clinic aims to increase clients' capacity to identify mental health needs and to access services through which they will be respected and effectively treated.The clinic is oriented to serving the needs of diverse populations and particularly those people historically discriminated against on the basis of race, sexual orientation, economic status, and other socio-cultural factors."

name: Melissa Foster
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description:
"I am a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist and an Art Therapist.  I help clients create healthier patterns in life and improve relationships. Services available for adults, couples, families and children.

My areas of emphasis include abuse, trauma, anxiety, depression, divorce, grief, parenting support, self-esteem, and personal growth. I am also trained in EMDR."

name: Anna Hawkins
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I welcome your rough edges, tender places, inner wisdom, and the search for more fulfillment.  Together, we will invite self-compassion and acceptance around what is already happening, while also creating ways to experience more satisfying ways of treating yourself, being with others, and inhabiting your life.  My clients include people who experience depression, anxiety, grief, anger, and shame, creative folks who are stalled at manifesting their potential, gentle souls who find it hard to navigate in a frenetic world, people who want to establish fresh relationship patterns, and those who are recovering their balance amidst life transitions."

name: Ryan Dunnigan
title: Psychologist
description: "I am a Police-Clinical Psychologist in the Bay Area and specialize in working with and treating police, law enforcement officers, firefighters, and emergency responders who are experiencing acute or chronic stress responses (including PTSD) and/or job-related issues.  I also conduct Pre-Employment Psychological Evaluations, Promotional Evaluations, and Fitness-for-Duty Evaluations for Law Enforcement Officers, Firefighters, Custody Personnel, and First Responders.  I am a Forensic Psychologist as well and can perform both Forensic interviewing and testing."

name: Dara Hayden
title: Psychologist
description: "Therapy can offer you the chance to increase your sense of personal satisfaction, improve your relationships and resolve specific concerns. Whether you are struggling with a recent challenge, or dealing with long term difficulties, I'd be glad to speak with you.  I offer a collaborative, compassionate, depth-oriented therapeutic style informed by current research in a confidential private practice setting. I meet with and welcome individuals and couples of all ethnic, cultural and religious backgrounds who may identify with traditional or non-traditional gender roles and sexual identities. Please contact me for more information, or to schedule an appointment."

name: Liz Michaud
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "My psycho-therapeutic treatment is informed by a broad ranging variety of approaches to psychology and healing. I am trained clinically and have worked within psychiatric settings working from Western psychological theories, however the heart of my work is strongly influenced by holistic and contemporary approaches to healing and change. This includes humanistic/existential psychology, attachment theory, intersectional feminist theory, LGBTQ affirmative therapy, transgenerational/multi-cultural theories, drama/expressive arts therapy, Eastern mindfulness theories, transpersonal psychology, somatic psychology and Gestalt psychology."

name: Clare Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I specialize in working with women who are experiencing break-ups, high-conflict relationship patterns, pre-marital transitions, and dating hopelessness. I work collaboratively with my clients to help them discover their true potential and reach the goals they set out to achieve. Together we will unearth long-standing patterns or negative perceptions that may be holding you back from experiencing a more fulfilling relationship. If you're looking for support and guidance through a challenging situation or you're ready to move in a new direction in your life, it could be a great time to begin."

name: Alan Bleiman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Selecting a therapist can be stressful, but it shouldn't be. With more than 20 years of professional experience, I offer thoughtful, nonjudgmental counseling in a comforting environment. If you are seriously considering seeing a therapist, I invite you to call to arrange a consultation."

name: Eva Wexler
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "If you are looking for assistance with parenting or co-parenting, I provide practical and compassionate guidance to couples and individuals around the complexities of caring for infants, children and adolescents.  Whether you need support around the transition of becoming a new parent, are having discord within your marriage regarding differences in parenting styles, or are in the process of separating or divorcing, I provide an empathic forum to discuss parenting challenges as well as provide real-world suggestions on how to improve interactions within your family."

name: Emilie C. Scovill
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "In the fast-paced, hyper-competitive Bay Area, it can be challenging to balance all of the roles that we assume. Work, school, money, technology, and relationship stressors can leave us feeling depleted. Anxiety, depression, low self-esteem, and career dissatisfaction are some of the ways stressors may manifest. My aim is to support and help to empower you to improve your life by engaging in the life that you want to lead. This may result in increased effectiveness, happiness, and reduced suffering in all of your roles."

name: Elvira Kitrar
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "My approach to psychotherapy is holistic. I not only treat the "tip of the iceberg" problems, but also address the deeper, "bottom of the ocean," issues. I treat the whole person and honor the mind-body-spirit connections, taking into account the client's cultural, religious and ethnic background, ancestry, race and immigration history. I recognize the complexity of each person's history and circumstances and employ a wide variety of techniques to guide my clients in their self-discovery."

name: Tracy LaRue Yalom
title: Psychologist
description: "My approach is interpersonal, both psychodynamically and existentially informed. I have been in practice for over 20 years. In my early years, I was supervised by Dr. Irvin Yalom, and he has been highly influential in my work. I believe my strengths include an ability to genuinely connect with patients in an empathic and non-judgmental manner.  I help my patients explore deeper issues and patterns underlying persistent unhappiness, as well as navigate life's hurdles that may feel overwhelming."

name: Meredith Exelrod
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Research has shown the connection between therapist and client is the most important indicator of whether a therapy will be successful. As you are on the search for the right therapist for you, I encourage you to keep this in mind.  As a therapist, I like to work collaboratively with my clients to support and strengthen what is already working and bring insight to areas that need more attention.  With compassion and kindness my aim is to help my clients gain concrete skills to foster greater well being and develop life long coping strategies to better manage difficult feelings."

name: James McCollum
title: Psychologist
description: "A good therapy session should feel emotional and immediate, yet grounded in the past so one can understand and feel old experiences in new ways. Sometimes there is laughter and sometimes there are tears. A good therapy session feels alive and feels satisfying."

name: Jessica Tracy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Psychotherapy can be a truly life changing process. It works to gradually loosen stuck patterns in one's life, leaving more room for vitality and creativity. You may be trying to heal from past wounds, experiencing anxiety, loneliness, depression, or relationship difficulties. Or perhaps you feel relatively stable but have a sense that something deeper is missing."

name: Leah A. Cochrane
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description:
"I work with those currently in a relationship--and those who would like to be in one--but who've found the road is a bit rocky. 
If you're a couple stuck in painful patterns, --or if you're single and attracted to the wrong kind of partner  --or find that you tend to "settle" because you lose hope of ever finding the right one for you...I can offer you a personalized, effective, satisfying approach, a way to stay true to yourself and yet be vibrantly open to the loving intimacy you seek."

name: Leah Chalofsky
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Are you looking for a therapist who is warm and supportive? Do you want to feel truly heard? Are you interested in exploring how childhood experiences have influenced your present life? Are you struggling with an unhealthy relationship or with high anxiety? You might be nervous to start therapy, so finding a therapist who will collaborate with you is important. I will focus on your strengths to help you heal and grow, while providing you with tools and safe place to explore.   I believe the relationship between the therapist and client offers opportunities for healing and transformation."

name: Emily G. Barrett
title: Psychologist
description: "Are you struggling to find meaning? Do you find yourself going through the motions of living, but not actually enjoying your life? My ultimate goal is to help people live more fully and to access their life's potential. I see adults and couples for psychotherapy. I believe that growth and change require a warm and trusting relationship. I will make every effort to help you feel both supported and challenged as we work together. I will also check in with you regularly to make sure you are getting what you need from therapy."

name: Richard Mungall
title: Associate Clinical Social Worker
description: "I'm here to assist you on your journey towards yourself. You have a thirst and a curiosity about life that goes beyond conventional boundaries. You come to therapy because you have an intuition that the life, philosophy, and possibilities this culture has offered you are too small. For you, it isn't enough to tame life by conceptually "knowing" what it is, you want to experience how things are directly and reclaim your inherent vitality. To make this journey you not only want someone to accompany you, but also someone who has gone to the heights and depths himself."

name: Bonnie Harrison
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "We all need support to get through difficult times in our lives.  If you are struggling with depression, anxiety, grief, or trauma, therapy can provide the tools for healing and transformation.  Whether you are looking for a sounding board when facing tough decisions about family or relationships, or you recognize a need for change in your life, the therapeutic process can support you.  Therapy should move at your pace, with a focus identified by you. In a non- judgmental and supportive atmosphere, we will work together to access your strengths and supports to find the most effective ways to cope."

name: Sarah Connelly
title: Psychologist
description: "Just as the words of a poem can open our eyes, minds and hearts in ways language otherwise might not be able to, I believe that psychotherapy is a creative process that utilizes language to access psychic terrain that's often inaccessible in our everyday lives. Accessing and exploring this internal terrain in therapy can be both enlightening and transformative."

name: Nikki Coffelt
title: Psychologist
description: "I support + guide you toward the most vibrant and authentic you possible!  My door is open to anyone with motivation for healing and/or self-actualization.  I tend to work best with artists, activists, addicts in recovery, therapy students, fellow healers, teens/adults interested in consciousness, highly sensitive types, LGBTQ & those on society's "edges."  I am a non-traditional psychologist/integrative healer, drawing heavily from my own recovery journey.  I have special expertise in resiliency, depression/grief/loss, anxiety, intergenerational trauma, addiction, creativity, experiences of oppression/marginalization, codependency/relationship difficulties & existential angst.  My work is holistic, intuitive & depth-oriented."

name: Debra Miller
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description:
""The more aspects of myself I am given the freedom to know and live without reacting to as right or wrong, good or bad, the more I can witness all the elements of who I am and the healthier I am"  ---Diane Shainberg.
 As a psychotherapist, I practice with the belief that therapy can be a rich and vital exploration into understanding the deepest parts of ourselves.The parts we cherish as well as the parts we want to change."

name: Ty Canning
title: Psychologist
description: "I work with individuals and couples looking to benefit from brief, problem-focused treatments that work. I provide treatment for individuals and/or couples coping with a wide range of concerns including trouble sleeping, anxiety, depression, couples conflict and concerns with sexual health. I am passionate about helping my patients optimize their physical, mental and emotional health and take a collaborative and practical approach. I am committed to making sure we are a good fit, so please feel free to call me for a complimentary phone consultation."

name: Lisa Shields
title: Psychologist
description: "Therapy is your journey.  If you invite me to walk along beside you, I will offer to you my best critical thinking, understanding, compassion and theoretical knowledge based on 20 years of working in this field.  I am adept at pointing out signposts, synchronicities, other paths and directions that you may not have noticed along the way.  Sometimes we need another set of eyes to tell us when we are just about to step in something gooey and stinky.  And other times we need help getting it off the bottoms of our shoes so that we can continue onward."

name: Ann Marie Dobosz
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Do you have a persistent feeling of "not good enough" that follows you from work to relationships to family? Does your mind race with thoughts about what you could have done better or how you disappointed someone? Other people might tell you that you work really hard, but your inner critic says it is not enough. You often feel self-critical and overwhelmed.Sometimes you are so paralyzed by anxiety that you can't finish work projects, make phone calls, or see friends. I can help you learn to manage anxiety, silence your inner critic, and feel good about yourself."

name: Louis Stephenson
title: Psychologist
description: "My approach to psychotherapy is to help my clients develop the ability to better rise to meet life's challenges, rather than avoid them. Whether a person's reasons for seeking therapy represent a struggle with their current stage in life, or a lifelong struggle, psychotherapy can be the gateway to a whole new way of understanding and experiencing life. I hope to help my clients to find peace, and to live a rich and meaningful life."

name: Abigail Thompson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Finding therapy can be frustrating- wading through dozens of profiles, wondering if this person is really going to be who you need. I get it. If you've worked hard to get where you are, but are still fighting to feel at home in your own body or safe in your relationships, you've come to the right place.  I like to think of myself as a playful, perceptive, and down-to-earth navigator in the search for clarity and confidence. I find this approach is very strong with people struggling with disordered eating, poor body image, anxiety, and relationships."

name: Ryan Moore
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate
description: "Are you struggling to find freedom from self-defeating patterns, addictions and feelings? Do find yourself returning to unhealthy relationships? Feeling stressed out and just getting by? You don't have to wrestle with these things alone! My goal is to create a safe and open space for you to explore your story and deepen your self understanding, putting you on a healing path to freedom, joy, and connection. I work with you to identify areas of frustration and concern, as well as areas of strength. My approach is relational and integrative; incorporating family systems, addiction, neuroscience, somatic, spiritual, and cultural perspectives."

name: Integrative Therapy and Relationship Counseling
description: "Therapy offers a powerful, almost sacred place to examine, heal and change one's life.  You don't need to endure your struggles alone.  In psychotherapy and relationship counseling you are invited to show up with all of who you are. All of your feelings are welcome.  With careful attention and compassion it is possible to move out of pain, discomfort and stuckness into greater ease, vitality and authenticity.  You will come to know yourself more fully and see yourself and your life through more compassionate understanding."

name: Carol Mills
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "Have you been struggling with feelings of anxiety or loss or sadness? Do you have questions and concerns about relationships with a spouse or a partner or a child? Are you recovering from substance abuse? Psychotherapy can offer a path to change and personal growth. We will engage in a conversation that will be shaped by you and your own unique goals and hopes for the future. I will be your ally, supporting your self-discovery and healing, looking for what is going right in your life and encouraging experimentation toward something new."

name: Carol Gould
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Do you feel stuck in your ability to form or maintain relationships?  If you are in a relationship, is it problematic or simply less satisfying than you would like it to be?  Do you feel depressed, empty, or anxious much of the time?  With warmth, humor, and a genuine desire to connect I create a safe space for individuals and couples to explore and overcome the obstacles that prevent them from achieving satisfaction in life and from feeling good about themselves."

name: Sharon Grossman
title: Psychologist
description: "Are you burned out? Do you wish you could be both successful and happy, but struggle with stress and balance? I am a Licensed Psychologist who specializes in working with lawyers, medical doctors, and other professionals in high-pressure careers. Areas of focus include stress management, resiliency training, and improved work-life integration. My clients acquire the skills they need to attain success, increase their happiness as well as heal from anxiety, depression, and trauma."

name: Matilda St John
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Struggling with anxiety can be a debilitating, frightening, and isolating experience. Whether the anxiety stems from trauma(s), trying to be "good" all the time, or something you can't quite put your finger on, together we can begin to understand and unravel the fears that are keeping you from living more fully. Many people I see are anxious for good reason, and their lives can be improved by learning ways to step back and take a broader view."

name: Adam Kaufman
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "I'm interested in helping people find greater happiness and meaning in their lives. We all have unique challenges, needs, and strengths, but it can sometimes feel hard to truly accept ourselves as we are. I offer a safe space for you to be yourself; it is from that place that healing and growth can best happen. Whether you are dissatisfied with your work, relationships, or your own patterns of behavior, we can work together to help you get what you want."

name: Sarah T. Harkness
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Reaching out for help often takes time--there are so many reasons we give ourselves for putting it off! I recognize your courage for being here at this time. You are at the point in your life or in your relationship, in which taking action towards healing feels necessary. With warmth, creativity and insight, I help people who are yearning to live an authentic life - a life that is real, instead of perfect.  One in which you learn to listen to your inner wisdom, to express your thoughts and feelings, and to face challenges with courage and integrity."

name: Martin Block
title: Psychologist
description: "I am a seasoned psychotherapist with more than 20 years of experience. The majority of my work is with people who are working to overcome anxiety, depression, relationship problems, job stress, addiction, and life transition concerns that are interfering with their ability to live a more satisfying and fulfilling life. Licensed and trained as a clinical psychologist and a MFT, I work with both individuals and couples, using a collaborative and active approach."

name: Megann Rither
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I APOLOGIZE, MY PRACTICE IS FULL AND CURRENTLY I AM UNABLE TO ACCEPT NEW CLIENTS.  Whether you're looking to address issues from the past or need support through a current situation, you do not have to do it alone.  Since 2002 I have counseled youth, adults, couples and families with overcoming obstacles while developing the tools necessary to maintain a healthy path.  Anxiety, depression, relationship concerns, life transitions and parenting are among the many issues with which I am able to help.  These stressors can lead to self-destructive behaviors or withdrawing from others in order to cope."

name: Matthew V. Moreno
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Relationships can either be a source of secure connection or of confusion and pain.  Ever week I help couples and individuals make sense of negative patterns, and support them to cultivate more secure, loving relationships.  I weave attachment theory, emotion focused therapy, and mindfulness psychotherapy to help clients get to the heart of their problems in a way that creates real, lasting, positive change."

name: Andy Weisskoff
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "I've been helping children and adults with mental health challenges since 1986. I have also been a specialist in Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) since 2006 when I was first trained in this very effective mode of treatment, I now work only with adults, most of whom have complex trauma, meaning people with histories of childhood emotional, physical and/or sexual abuse -- experiences which continue to cause problems into adulthood. I also work with people with anxiety who do not have trauma histories, as in the case of phobias like fear of driving, flying or public speaking."

name: Mary Zimtricht
title: Psychologist
description: "You're looking for a therapist and you're wondering if I might be a good fit.  It might help to know that I'm a straightforward, perceptive, and non-judgmental practitioner. The therapy I provide is not one-size-fits-all, but instead is collaborative and customized to your specific needs and way of being. I'll ask questions and engage in dialogue with you throughout the process. By providing thoughtful, individual focus to you as you tackle patterns of living that no longer work, we'll discover new areas for growth and healing."

name: Sara Lesser
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description:
"Are you fighting a lot? Is there a lack of passion? I enjoy helping couples to reconnect and to feel more satisfied in their relationship. I will help you learn new more effective ways to communicate and skills that will allow you to feel more compassion towards one another.
I help people figure out what is wrong, make real changes and find ways to live a more fulfilling life. My style is collaborative, genuine and interactive. I believe humor can be an important part of getting through difficult times."

name: Deborah Yarock
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "For the past 30 years, I have supported people navigating anxiety, stress, and overwhelm to rediscover their aliveness, agency, and the gifts that can come from even the most difficult experiences. As a highly interactive and warm person, I believe the quality of our therapeutic relationship is a major part of healing. Deeply intuitive and strength based by nature, I help you recognize your innate wisdom to creatively reshape your life. In the supportive environment of therapy, you are invited to unfold at your very own pace while facing challenges and perceived limitations."

name: Ashley Grant
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I work well with with individuals who are feeling stuck or have a hard time being close or intimate with others.  I help people learn to feel comfortable speaking your mind.  I want to support you to say the difficult things.  We all have reasons why it is hard to communicate- we are people pleasers, we are worried what the other will think, we hate conflict...the list goes on.  Let me help you learn how to find ways to communicate that feel comfortable for you."

name: Jan Messer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I have helped individual adults, couples and families for over 25 years in my private psychotherapy practice. I offer an in-depth, insightful, potent and integrative approach which blends Psychodynamic, Psychoanalytic, Jungian and Mindfulness orientations."

name: Diana Gray
title: Psychologist
description: "Now is the time to talk to someone!  With 25 + years experience as a psychotherapist, clinical supervisor, and academic teacher,  I feel confident in my abilities to help you become more of whom you want to be.  Whether it's work stress, relationship issues, care-giving, disability, substance abuse, depression or anxiety, it is frequently helpful to talk to a skilled, licensed professional.   I am direct, encouraging, and can help you focus on your most important issues."

name: Joanna Ricco
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Just trying to live day to day in San Francisco can feel overwhelming, confusing, tiring, and full of more questions than answers. While you may be navigating the dating scene, sharing small spaces, and wondering how you'll ever feel stable in this economy, therapy can be your grounding place to take a deep breath and live fully in the moments. Guidance through psychotherapy can be the portal to a renewed sense of self. To find clarity by finding your voice is a skill that you will learn to cultivate for years to come."

name: Mia Maturen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "My style is warm, collaborative, playful, direct, and flexible. Psychotherapy is one of the few places where individuals are free to explore and express themselves in a deeply personal way. People come to therapy for different reasons and with different goals in mind. I am committed to offering a space that is innovative and values uniqueness, developing a way of working with you that accounts for your complexity and individual preferences. I encourage open dialogue and feedback regarding what you find helpful."

name: Cara Zeisloft
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "I offer practical help for a wide variety of issues, including difficulty in relationships, conflicts with others, or simply the feeling that your life isn't going the direction you want. I will help you take an honest look at the issue, the feelings you're having, and what to do next.  My style is straightforward, active, warm, and clear, and I encourage our thinking creatively together about your situation. I will openly share my thoughts and ideas with you, and will focus on making sure our collaboration is working for you."

name: Megan E Kelly
title: Psychologist
description: "Dr. Kelly specializes in working with individuals across the life span who are navigating life transitions, relationship conflict, or identity issues. She provides evidence-based treatments and aims to empower clients as they navigate change and growth. Through an active and collaborative approach, Dr. Kelly provides an environment in which clients can learn new techniques to cope with stress, explore difficult emotions, and increase their connection to personal values and fulfillment. In particular, she has a special interest in working with women who are navigating challenges related to pregnancy, perinatal, and postpartum issues."

name: Suzanne R Berger
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "You can explore life's experiences without fear of judgment in a safe, comfortable place.  I enjoy guiding people who want more satisfaction in their relationships, increased inspiration at work, and greater power in their lives. I have an insightful and good humored style supporting people from all walks of life."

name: Rhonda Felzmann
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Sometimes life presents challenges that are too difficult to manage on one's own and therapy can be an excellent choice to address those obstacles. Therapy provides a conversation that is not available in any other relationship.  I invite people to explore and clarify what they want and together we identify the barriers and create attainable goals.  We will work together to understand what really matters to you. My treatment style is warm, direct, humorous and deeply respectful  While each individual client requires something unique to them, in general, I offer practical solutions while also using an insight-orientated approach."

name: Candice Candelaria
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "My private psychotherapy practice focuses on helping individuals, couples & families, in the Bay Area, overcome obstacles that are holding them back from living out the life they desire. I provide guidance through anticipated milestones like starting a new career path, exploring personal identity, preparing for marriage or the birth of a child, and unexpected life events such as emotionally navigating through a divorce, coping with the death of a loved one, recovering from a traumatic event, managing feelings of anxiety or depression, or overcoming challenges with alcohol or drug use."

name: Tom Bruett
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "You can feel more satisfied and authentic in your life.  You don't have to do it alone.  We will work together to heal your relationships, build your support network and face the pain that has been holding you back.  You may be feeling fear, hesitation or reluctance to start the process of therapy, and that is completely understandable!  But you deserve to feel better.  I'm here for the long haul and if you're ready to do the work, change is possible."

name: Thomas Masat
description: "I am a San Francisco Therapist who focuses on Psychotherapy for Men. Much of that work focuses on the underlying issues symptomatic of using porn, apps, and compulsive sexual behaviors. Sex, whether alone or partnered, can be a healthy expression of your innate desire to connect, enjoy, have fun, and celebrate who you are. Difficulty connecting with others is distressing. I recognize the anxiety, consequences, and suffering when porn, apps, and sexual behaviors are out of sync with who you want to be. I can provide tools to create positive change."

name: Dalynn May
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description:
"I have worked with a wide variety of people and have a track record of success helping individuals and couples understand themselves and their relationships more fully. Your past does not have to shape your future. I am trained to help you shape the future you want.


If you are an INDIVIDUAL or a COUPLE who wants to: 

*Improve your Relationship, *Reduce your Anxiety,  *Gain control over your Depression, *Grow and Evolve, or *Increase your Self-Esteem and sense of Self-Confidence, then I would like the opportunity to help you."

name: Cynthia Cohn
title: Psychologist
description: "For 14 years, I have worked w/adults, couples, and teens who want to feel better/make changes in their lives--including technology, media, creative professionals; academics; physicians; attorneys; students (high school--graduate.) Whether relationship crisis, life transition, trauma, stress/overwhelm, anxiety/depression, loneliness; you need help expressing feelings/connecting w/self/others; you seek a more creative/fulfilling life; or just feel lost or stuck, I can help. Good therapy can be transformative--lead to feeling more alive, true to yourself, satisfied. Together we'll uncover the patterns of thinking/relating/behavior behind your distress and work to relieve your suffering, achieve your goals."

name: Paul Thibeault
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate
description: "Are you trying to address a long standing problem or has life presented you with a new challenge? I offer a calm presence, compassion and faith that you can achieve your goals, in part because you've already been motivated to consider therapy. I have several years of training and experience working with individuals (children and adults), couples and families. And I've worked with people from all walks of life covering a wide variety of issues. I look forward to finding out how I can support you and what we can achieve together."

name: Corinna Press
title: Psychologist
description: "Berkeley Office: I am not taking any new referrals at this time.   Fairfield Office: Our practice is currently full and we are not able to accommodate new patients at this time. I will update this notice as soon as this changes."

name: Ivette M Huerta
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I am a licensed bilingual Spanish-speaking Marriage and Family therapist who specializes in child and family therapy as well as infant and early childhood.  I have been working with the 0-5 population, parents, families, and children for over 17 years.  My extensive training consists of working with infant mental health and developmental care.  My training and experience has taught me how to embrace the the importance of relationships between a parent and their child.  I have worked with children and families who've  struggle with depression, anxiety, developmental issues/challenges, feeding issues, regulatory issues, sensory issues, learning differences, behavioral challenges and special needs."

name: Esther Wanning
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Your potential is much greater than you even think. But psychological burdens   -- such as depression, loneliness, guilt, and anxiety -- rob you of the freedom to feel, act, and choose.  Self-protective strategies left over from childhood, ingrained but faulty ideas, and an absence of self-acceptance make life very, very difficult. How we work together will depend on what you want and what you need. Cognitive-behavioral techniques can be very valuable. But for many people, the path includes uncovering buried emotions, giving the "true self" a chance to emerge. Our closeness gives you the courage you'll need."

name: Amanda Stason
title: Counselor
description: "This may come as a surprise to you, but if you are looking for regular "talk therapy" I lovingly suggest you contact someone else. Most of my clients have done a lot of therapy and personal growth work with some rewards, but without getting to the core of what they are seeking. Integrating the best of body-centered psychotherapy, mindfulness and spiritual inquiry, I support my clients to listen deeply to their own inner wisdom, heal the wounds that are ready to be healed and discover what they most need to move forward in their lives. www.amandastason.com"

name: Rachel L Pepper
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Ready for change? Let's get to it! Most people find therapy works, so make a commitment to yourself today. We can meet for just a few sessions to help you over a hump, meet every other week for some fine tuning to address and change your patterns at work or in your relationships, or meet every week if you prefer ongoing, supportive therapy. I'm flexible in my approach and believe in the healing nature of this work. Clients find me compassionate,  a good listener, and able to help prompt a client's own insights about change. I look forward to hearing from you!"

name: Abbie Endres
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "You've begun a courageous search.  Take heart, healing is possible.  Rooted in the body/mind connection, nourished by the imagination, and anchored in the support of our therapy relationship, my work includes both directing and listening.  I understand that your timing and willingness to explore your concerns are unique and must be navigated with respect.  We work together to take stock, talk about your goals, and gather the tools needed - from your own strengths and the training I bring - to help you begin or continue your journey of wellness."

name: Laura Tabak
title: Psychologist
description: "I am a licensed clinical psychologist who helps children, adolescents and adults address a range of concerns, including: self-esteem issues, unsatisfying relationships, work stress, self-destructive behaviors, trauma, and grief/loss. I consult with parents to help them develop and implement behavioral strategies and parenting plans when their child is exhibiting behavioral issues at home and/or at school."

name: Helen Ariz Casaclang
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "Psychotherapist Helen Ariz Casaclang, a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) has adequate knowledge, training and skills on advanced individual psychotherapy, towards enhance coping,  healing and wellness of individuals."

name: Cary Dakin
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "At the most basic level, therapy is a conversation. What makes it unique is it's an environment in which you can bring forth the most complex and sensitive subjects, and trust the person listening is poised to hear you with respect, compassion and interest in your well-being. Together we reach an understanding of what you're experiencing, and create solutions geared toward easing your discomfort."

name: Jennifer Diamond
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate
description: "Maybe you would like more support and a space that's just for you.  There's the constant hum in the background of wanting a fuller, more meaningful life. Maybe you feel disconnected from your partner, your family or yourself. You are grieving a loss.  You are feeling sad or anxious or angry. Let's figure it out together."

name: Tracy McGillis
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "I provide a safe, empathic, and non-judgmental space to explore any issues that have brought you to therapy. I work with individuals and couples at all developmental stages, partnering with you to navigate the uncertainties of life transitions, relationship difficulties, and barriers that may be keeping you stuck. Most of us want to move in the direction of a meaningful, authentic life that reflects our values, but for various reasons the path becomes obscured. I both challenge and support my clients in their courageous steps toward clarity and fulfillment."

name: Antonia M Bercovici
title: Psychologist
description: "I work with my patients in an environment of mutual cooperation and responsibility to improve their lives with treatment plans that build on their emotional, intellectual, and interpersonal strengths."

name: Jeremy Sinkinson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: ""You cannot stop the waves, but you can learn to surf." - Jon Kabat Zinn.  I provide psychotherapy services specializing in boosting self-esteem and social value by helping you to meet your needs and desires. I also provide child and family therapy to help kids, teens, and parents to build stronger relationships. I welcome parent participation! Family is important and families are influential. Therapy is a place to learn to value yourself and develop a healthy identity in the world through processing what you think and feel."

name: Astraea Bella, LCSW
description: "Creating a loving, passionate, and fulfilling relationship doesn't come naturally.  It requires key skills.  Cutting edge scientific research has revealed the key skills that make the biggest difference.  I can teach those to you, step by step.  You can learn how to build a loving, passionate, and fulfilling relationship.  It's likely you will be surprised to discover how effective these skills are, and how good it feels to practice them."

name: Jessica Kilborn
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Psychotherapy is a creative, collaborative and unique process where we explore the being that is you. This is a challenging endeavor and sometimes takes a great deal of bravery to make an appointment. Safety in the relationship we create is of the utmost importance to me and I work carefully with you to ensure that we establish a solid foundation from which we can move outward."

name: Carla L Durkin
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
description: "Over 17 years practicing has affirmed my belief that most of the emotional wounding and on-going pain, difficulties, confusion and "stuckness" plaguing individuals, and the relational problems of couples can move and improve significantly in psychotherapy with a warm, intelligent, highly attuned, interactive, and skilled psychotherapist.  I work hard at creating a safe, reliable and connected therapeutic relationship, in which the client feels comfortable, seen, understood and accepted for who they are, communicated with honestly and directly, and free to drive the focus, pace and intensity as feels right to them."

name: Rosa Lutrario
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "As a therapist, I believe that we attain personal development through our relationship with others, and that connecting with a therapist can provide a unique opportunity to address our fears, voice our deepest aspirations, and discover unknown parts of ourselves."

name: Jon Nicholas Blauw
title: Psychologist
description: "Services available:  Therapy for Depression and Anxiety, Couples Counseling, Family Counseling, Parenting Support, Work and Career issues, Stress Management, Addiction & Recovery, and Conflict Resolution.  Also available are Life Coaching, Psychological Testing and Consultation for therapists who may want a second opinion to better serve you. I work with a wide range of emotional and behavioral issues providing services that span from therapy for depression and problem drinking to parenting support, couples counseling and beyond. I offer low fee or "sliding scale" services and can do online sessions through Skype or Line in California and Colorado or countries outside the US."

name: Michelle Leao, MFT
description: "I am a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist that works with children, parents, families, and individuals that are experiencing challenges in their lives that may have stemmed from early childhood trauma, generational trauma, or those who were born with biological traits that drastically differer from their parents.  I have extensive history working with families and children who are strained from challenging behaviors, unproductive familial patterns, and ongoing parent-child conflict."

name: Amanda Murray
title: Psychologist
description: "If you feel anxious, odd, or out of place, I want to help you connect with the relationships and activities you care about. I assist children and adults who are dealing with stress, challenging life transitions, and conditions such as social anxiety and Autism/Asperger's in learning the skills they need to thrive. If you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable in your own skin at times, I want to support you in harnessing your existing strengths and developing additional coping tools and communication skills."

name: Jason Mark Thompson
title: Psychologist
description: "I work within a relational psychoanalytic framework. That means I hold a theory of psychotherapy based an understanding of the human mind as integrally connected to the significant relationships in our life, going back to early childhood, and the ways those relationships shape our sense of self. Your task is to express yourself freely, mine to listen with a commitment to understanding you without judgement,  attending to the whole of your experience. Over time, I believe it is this experience of being seen, heard and understood which creates the possibility for recovery, growth, and transformation."

name: Katie Fenton-Strauss
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
description: "*Currently accepting new clients*  Chances are, you treat yourself in ways that you would never treat another person.   It is difficult to connect with other people and keep positive relationships when you are beating yourself up inside.  You hold grudges against yourself for past mistakes, and you magnify your imperfections.   I believe this harsh treatment of self is behind many painful emotions, and leads to destructive and self-defeating behavior.  We will untangle this together, and I will help set you on a path to working for, instead of against, yourself to meet your goals.  INDIVIDUALS AND COUPLES therapy available."
